body: It seems that exposing monitor rotation would be better (breaking) API. But this is a good intermediate fix.
@shurcooL That was what I did first, but then realized, knowing about the rotation is useless if the coordinate system behave as expected.

rename.from: GLFWvidmode width/height  doesn't take in the account monitor rotation.
rename.to: Video modes don't take monitor rotation into account

body:
@capnm's solution appears to be correct. Will verify behavior on Windows and OS X before pushing.

@jherico That code has now been replaced with a call to `_glfwChooseVideoMode`, so the solution above is global.

@shurcooL Since rotation is a property of the CRTC and not the individual video mode, it would be exposed with a (non-breaking) window hint. I can't see it being a priority for a while to come, though, unless it turns out to be necessary for smooth Rift support.
